column1: Trauma patients who develop a tracheal or bronchial rupture often have other injuries.
Patients may: - Cough up blood - Develop bubbles of air that can be felt underneath the skin of the chest, neck, arms, and trunk - Have difficulty breathing
People who have had a trauma will need to have their injuries treated.
A collapsed lung is treated with a chest tube connected to suction, which re-expands the lung.
Antibiotics are used in patients with an infection in the part of the lung around the injury.
